intro: Ornithopus monocarpus, commonly known as the slender rocket, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its upright, branching stems and small, bright yellow flowers. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, elongated seed pods. Ornithopus monocarpus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe.
